channel.title: Homes on Rola Dali
channel.description: Recent content in Homes on Rola Dali

item.title: Biography
item.description: I am a Research Scientist, Software Developer and Data Analyst at McGill University’s C3G, probing questions related to human health by building and using bioinformatics tools. I am an organized modular thinker who breaks problems into their individual, manageable building blocks. I am also an efficient problem solver, with an eye for detail.

item.title: Publications
item.description: An Arf/Rab cascade controls the growth and invasiveness of glioblastoma. BiorXiv 2020. Gopinath Kulasekaran, Mathilde Chaineau, Valerio E. Piscopo, Federica Verginelli, Martine Girard, Maryam Fotouhi, Yeman Tang, Rola Dali, Rita Lo, Stefano Stifani, Peter S. McPherson Groucho/TLE opposes axial to hypaxial motor neuron development. BiorXiv 2020. Ad√®le Salin-Cantegrel, Rola Dali, Jae Woong Wang, Marielle Beaulieu, Mira Deshmukh, Ye Man Tang, Stefano Stifani Avoidance Learning Using Observational Reinforcement Learning.

item.title: Skills
item.description: Programming Skills: Python: numpy, pandas, matplotlib, seaborn, ggplot2, plotly, sklearn, Keras, jupyter notebooks R: ggplot2, lattice, base R, limma, Genomics Ranges, R markdown notebooks Other languages: Bash, awk , Java Markdown & styling: HTML, CSS, markdown Version control using git: github, bitbucket (user: rdali) High Performance Computing: Batch, PBS/Torque, Slurm Operating Systems: Mac, Linux, Windows Framework development Software installation and configuration Automated testing using Jenkins Miscellaneous: Docker, Virtual machines, GSoC Admin for 2018/2019/2020, Season of Docs Admin for 2019, Hackathon: McHacks 2017

item.title: Experience
item.description: C3G Technology Development Team - Montreal, QC July 2017 - current Software Developer & Data Analyst I am part of the technology development team at McGill University’s C3G. We are an academic research entity that focuses on writing open source tools for the genomics community, providing data analysis support for academics and training researchers to run bioinformatics analyses. My role involves several tasks at C3G, under three broad categories:

item.title: Education
item.description:
Professional Development Certificate in Data Science and Machine Learning McGill University 2018-2019
PhD in NeuroScience & Bioinformatics McGill University 2011-2017
B.Sc in Biochemistry University of Ottawa 2006-2010

item.title: Blog
item.description: I keep notes and tutorials in Computer Science, Data Science and various topics. Check it out at: Food4Thought: Journals of a meandering mind
